name: BEST WESTERN PLUS Hibiscus Motel

reviews.text: We just stayed for 3 days at this hotel. As a family of four with two big teenagers, we all stayed in one standard room and found it to be very comfortable. Room was very clean and everything seemed new and fresh. There was a small fridge and microwave in the room, additional sink and mirror outside the bathroom and a large flat screen TV. The only things we could nitpick about was the noise from the A/C and bathroom fan was a bit loud but nothing we couldn't handle. There is a nice pool area with lots of shade and palm trees. The pool was obviously heated - too warm for our taste, but I think many people like pool temps in the mid to high 80's (not us). There was free breakfast, free parking and free internet. I dont think you will find this at too many hotels in Key West. I would rate BW Hibiscus as a very good value. Location is very good too. It is is old town Key West, right across the street from the Southernmost Hotel. Good restaurants within walking distance and just a very short walk to Duval Street. It is a bit too far to walk to the boardwalk and north end of the Key. One piece of advice to this hotel and some of its staff that would make it 5 stars IMO...smile, say good morning or good afternoon and pretend you like having guests staying there. This goes a long way to making guests feel welcome. Nothing that would stop us from staying here again, but we would have rated it even higher.
reviews.title: Good Value in Key West

reviews.text: A nice place with an excellent pool area, very close to the quiet and southernmost area of Key West. Walking distance to Mallory Square. Quite even on a new years eve, nice and tidy. Free parking! Free wifi, fast.
reviews.title: Affordable.

reviews.text: I took my dad and his partner to Key West for Christmas. I was able to find a suite at the BW Plus. It was clean, and perfect for our needs - a bedroom for my dad and his partner, on a patio for them to step outside to smoke, and within walking distances of anything I'd want to see (although my dad and his partner aren't able to walk that far most of the time). Free breakfast and wi-fi and a pleasant staff. Fair price for a holiday in high season - and for a suite.
reviews.title: Suite Deal for Christmas...

reviews.text: Breakfast is rather crowded - it's a small room, and obviously we are all motivated by hot coffee and free breakfast. Good selections - I enjoyed the breakfast sandwiches. The coffee system could be a little better - it's a machine, and it has to stop every 6 cups to heat water, so the line for coffee can be a little long in the first two hours of breakfast.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: If you plan on staying here during Spring Break 2013, let me warn you of the roudy kids you will be staying with. Last year my wife and I spent a night here in March during spring break and it was not relaxing as we wanted. The college kids took over the poolside area playing beer pong in the pool. They set up their table on inflatable lounge mats in the shallow end and the beer was spilling over into the pool all the while management saw this going on. When I approached the front desk with this, they said the kids spend a lot of money to stay here also, and should have fun too,... Wow, are you kidding! I was able to speak with a couple of kids, and they said they were sleeping 4-8 per room without management knowing and only paying for 2 in a room. They split the cost equally keeping it affordable for them. Some kids slept on floor. I should have spent my $280.00 elsewhere. Don't waste your money here, go somewhere else!
reviews.title: Beware of Spring Break

reviews.text: I had a family trip in Key West in December 2012 and we spent one hight there. Our room was 205 and when we were about to go bed, my wife was shocked at mutiple bugs moving around on the bed - I'm attaching photos of them.
reviews.title: You should expect bugs!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was jus the beginning - like many other problematic cases, the real matter was how it was dealt with by responsible people. The hotel staff who came to us simply suggested that we move to another room and didn't much care about the bugs - he didn't express apology for the occasion and didn't even show any sympathy! He also said that it's not unusual to find those bugs in hotels in Florida - I didn't understand at all how he could say that. That means we should expect those bugs in hotel beds!
reviews.title: Enjoyable with a few drawbacks...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Next day, I talked with another person (maybe the manager) and she didn't seem any different.
reviews.title: Great location, great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed one night at the Hibiscus. The reception staff were great, helping us to sort out various problems such as arriving a day early by mistake, registering for the Sunpass toll system etc. The location is good, within walking distance of all the main attractions; there was free parking; and free continental breakfasts. Our room was on the lower floor and rather gloomy but we were grateful to be accommodated after we messed up our booking. The warm pool was a dream.
reviews.title: Good location, lovely pool

reviews.text: The BW Hibiscus has the perfect location for experiencing Key West. It's in the Old Town, close to Duval and Truman. Park in their large lot and see KW on foot. The rooms are large and clean; the bathroom is updated. The pool, hot-tub, and pool deck have been fun. Breakfast is excellent. Staff is helpful. Best may be no surprises. Just solid value.
reviews.title: Good value does happen in Key West!

reviews.text: Great location, nice rooms, lovely warm pool and within walking distance of Duvall St. We all enjoyed the walk downtown and did it a couple of time a day. They a a very nice breakfast and the front desk staff were very helpful. Would stay here again without a doubt.
reviews.title: Everything you could want

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here 13 yrs ago on the advice of my parents who had stayed here. Since then, refurbished, most attractively. We also like the location as walkable to Duval--but quiet and not honky tonk at all. The room is large. The outdoor heated pool is divine. The free breakfast is adequate. The room is clean and has wireless and 2 sinks. There are two computers in the lobby with a printer. There is ample outdoor seating and free parking. You don't need a car within Key West. Half a block away is South St. with both bike rentals and a cute place to grab cafe con leche. The pharmacy formerly across the street from the Hibiscus has closed alas and turned into a bank - it sued to have great fish sandwiches and also cafe con leche. It was called Dennis's I think and I had read about it in Jane and Michael Sterm. Same folks who wrote about Blue Heaven. Thirteen years ago we paid $999 now $125 can't beat that. The keys to the doors are a little balky so try repeatedly.
reviews.title: We are very happy here again.

reviews.text: Great location near quiet end of Duval St. Easy walk to tram stop - can walk to Mallory Sq if desired. Several nice restaurants in immediate vicinity. One of nicest BWs we've been to. large room, nicely furnished with lovely large pool outside door.
reviews.title: Great location, great room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are very clean and large. They have a very nice pool area and the pool is open until midnight. Pool towels are provided in your room. The beds are softer than we prefer but their appearance was worse than the actuality. We had two queen beds and chose to sleep separately so we didn't roll to the center. The bed I slept in had a visible dip in the center but didn't feel that bad when sleeping. My husband has a back problem and a firmer bed would have helped him.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast is provided but the breakfast area is small and cannot accomodate everyone. They have a variety of items: muffins, bagels, variety of bread for toast, cereal, yogurt, fruits, juice, coffee, and a rotating hot choice such as waffles, sausage, egg, and cheese biscuits, or biscuits and gravy. One problem we had during our stay was the coffee machine was not working properly and was down on two mornings in a row. Management needs to correct that problem!
reviews.title: nice little spot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They also have free wi-fi, if you are able to access it. Each area of the motel seems to be on a different hook-up but none of them have a strong signal. My Ipad was constantly trying to update and was not able to keep up. If you absolutely need access, this may not be the place for you. I got frustrated with the situation regularly and finally gave up.
reviews.title: Nice, reasonably priced place to stay in Key West

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is great as long as you are able to walk or have transportation. It is located in the southernmost area so is a bit of a walk to the more active end of Duval St. or to Mallory Square. We did it several times, however, so it is quite doable. We also used the Old Town Trolley to learn a bit about the town but more as a means of transportation so we didn't have to walk all the time. There is a stop a block away.
reviews.title: Strategically Located in Old Town

description: Two-story Motor Lodge located 3 blocks from southernmost point in the United States, in restoration area of Old Town.
